architectural_notes: System uses Internet Identity principals to identify/authorize users (agents/admin) and link agent records to II accounts.
known_issues: Production deployment is failing with a deployment error (details not provided).
Admin and agent dashboards load slowly after login / not opening quickly.

existing_features.title: Prevent `useActor()` from blocking initial dashboard load on access-control initialization when no admin token is present by skipping the `_initializeAccessControlWithSecret` call if the `caffeineAdminToken` secret parameter is missing/empty, and ensure failures in that initialization do not prevent normal users from reaching their dashboards.

Improve dashboard bootstrap resilience and perceived performance by ensuring the UI can show the dashboard shell quickly while essential data loads, using existing loading/skeleton patterns (e.g., keep `DashboardOverview` skeletons) and avoiding full-screen loading states longer than necessary once authentication is complete.

new_feature_requests.summary: Reduce dashboard bootstrap latency by preventing `useActor()` from force-refetching all React Query queries immediately after the actor becomes available; instead, only invalidate dependent queries (or refetch a minimal, explicitly-defined set) so the dashboard can render quickly after login.

projectName: Speed up Admin/Agent dashboard load after Internet Identity login
